newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch central bank allocates fresh liquidity.
newsitem.headline: Dutch central bank allocates fresh liquidity.

text.p: The Dutch central bank said on Friday it had allocated 3.84 billion guilders to the money market under a seven-day special advances pact at an unchanged rate of 2.90 percent.
Individual banks received 13.6 percent of the amount they had applied for, with the central bank setting a ceiling of 4.0 billion guilders on applications.
The new pact replaces a seven-day facility of 3.49 billion guilders which expired today.
